intro: Edechia inermis, commonly known as the smooth edgeworthia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Magnoliaceae family, characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with numerous stamens that give them a fluffy appearance.
